snippet: Although the landmark Brooklyn restaurant, situated on a barge in the East River, was heavily damaged in Hurricane Sandy, its tradition and civility cannot be washed away.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column laments severe damage to River Cafe in Brooklyn by Hurricane Sandy; says restaurant had air of fragility, being built on water, but also feeling of permanence in longstanding relationships and loyalties it fostered.
lead_paragraph: Although the landmark Brooklyn restaurant, situated on a barge in the East River, was heavily damaged in Hurricane Sandy, its tradition and civility cannot be washed away.

headline.print_headline: At River Café, a Loss Of the Finer Things
headline.seo: At the River Café, Assessing the Losses of the Finer Things
headline.main: At River Café, a Loss of the Finer Things
